segments.text: When you are in a restaurant and you want the waiter to bring the bill , what do you do to attract his attention ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I just make eye contact with him and nod my head . Then I tell him when he comes over to the table . Why do you ask ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I went out with my girlfriend to a nice restaurant last night and I noticed that many people shouted for the bill .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That seems a little impolite in such a restaurant .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s what I thought . I just thought I ’ d ask you and see what you thought of it . Anyway , what did you do yesterday evening ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , it was a warm evening , so I stretched my legs . I walked along the canal for a couple of miles . Actually , several other people had the same idea . I saw Bill .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you ? How is he these days ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He seemed ok . We didn ’ t stop and chat because we were on opposite banks of the canal . We just waved at each other .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I need to move some furniture . Could you help me to lift it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course . What do you want to move first ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Let ’ s move the sofa . Can you get a grip on the bottom at that end ? I ’ ll lift this end . I want to move it sideways in that direction .
segments.speaker: S1
